en: [Letter] 1835 Jun. 19, New Tazewell [to] David Hunt, Franklin County / John Hunt

The following document is a letter written by John Hunt in New Tazewell to his brother David in Franklin County and dated June 19, 1835. In the letter, John explains that he plans to retire from his 18 years as sheriff and move to the rich lands of the Missouri River.

The following document is a letter written by John Hunt in New Tazewell to his brother David in Franklin County and dated June 19, 1835. In the letter, John explains that he plans to retire from his 18 years as sheriff and move to the rich lands of the Missouri River.

none: [Letter] 1835 Jun. 19, New Tazewell [to] David Hunt, Franklin County / John Hunt : page 1

body.value: Near tazewell June 19th 1835 Dear Sir having an opertunity opportunity at this time to drop you a line by person Mr Martin I can inform you that the family are all well at presant present only Rhody the pain in hir her breast gets wors worse constantly I am looking constantly for hir her to take hir her bead She Still keeps a bout about the greater part of hir her time I am Very much trobeled troubled with pains in my Joints I have no means thats is worth communicating to you, I have had 2 letters from my children that has gon gone to the mosoriee missouri the rite right the have got in a contry country of Rich land and is very productive fine range gain in great quality Honey plenty I intend going out there in April next to See the contry country I cannot go any Sooner on the account of my business as Shff Sheriff I will try to wind up this fall and winter I have served as Sheriff 18 years come march next and I think it is time for me to quit as I am geting getting old and tired of the business F.S. Hunt is Running for the legislator and will be Elected very Easy James Overton is his a ponant opponent who you know has no tallents talents for nothing in the world he tells the people he is a farmer and he goes for the farmers intrusts interests , ourt crops of small grain is very much infered inferred by the wet it has rained in this county Every day for 3 or 4 weeks more or less I believe Fidilo was at place taledego Talladega a fiew few days Since at his unkle uncle georges the was all well he likes that contry country very well please rite write to me as I would be glad to hear from you give my Respects to John & Henry Lurkins all the friends it is likely I will pass throug through your contry country one time mor more if I Ever Should get any thing of Mayfield and if not I do not Expect Ever to See you again So I am most respectfully your brother till death John Hunt David Hunt

body.value: David Hunt Esqr Esquire Franklin county near Solemn bears creek
